Pre-reqs: PHIL 340.
This course is an intensive study of some topics emerging from Quines philosophy, with special attention to questions in metaphysics and philosophy of logic. We will study Quines views on ontology, empiricism, truth, logical truth, apriority, modality and belief. We will explore how these different topics interconnect, and how Quines views are related to those of other philosophers of the twentieth century, especially Frege, Russell, and Carnap.
description: Intensive study of a major philosopher such as Wittgenstein, Russell, or Heidegger, or school, such as pragmatism or logical empiricism.
